not going to spend as much time there as I will on app stream so workspaces are
really the managed cloud desktop solutions right desktop as a service it's a pay-as-you-go model with
workspaces we have two different options there's a monthly purchase option if you're really looking at a desktop
replacement approach and then there's a an hourly option for users who don't need full time access something to know
about that is the break-even point tends to be around 82 hours depending on the instance size that you're using the
bundle size that you're using for workspaces so even for part-time users if they're doing more than 82 hours it
may be more cost-effective to use the always-on bundle types or sorry the always-on workspace types for that
solution and we do offer a workspaces cost optimizer that will monitor your
environment and help make recommendations on usage patterns that it sees for workspaces and guide you
into which ones may be better suited as hourly versus versus monthly and we can also set that service to automatically
convert your workspaces for you it's a couple of lambda scripts that run in the in your account you can find that in the
AWS solutions builder website workspaces is built on a secure platform so
end-to-end encryption initial authentication to the service is through through ssl over 443 once the session is
established it supports aes-256 encryption for the streaming session
which stream using Terry deechi's PC over IP protocol that's tcp and UDP ports 4172
and that's for the it for the entire session the web client workspaces has a web client that will communicate an over
PC over IP if it's available if 4172 is not open in your environment it will fall back to SSL over 443 so you get the
highest level of encryption in your workspaces there is a pc IP ADM that file that you can import into your
group policy management console you can disable those lower encryption standards
we do support two AES 128 and one or two other encryption standards if you disable those it will always fall back
to AES 256 you know additionally workspaces are storing data in the
clouds as far as security goes you're leaving nothing on and end-user device it's really hard to leave a cloud
computer in an airport lounge so that user data is protected if that's not enough we also offer encryption for that
local storage so you can encrypt your data at rest that'll help you meet audit policies or just to you know increase
your security posture in general the key management services are used for for
workspaces encryption you can either use our keys use your own this ensures that the EBS volumes that back your
workspaces are encrypted there's a user data volume and a system volume you can decide whether you want to encrypt both
or one or the other or currently you can currently leave neither of them encrypted and and then workspaces of
course are simple to deploy and manage there's no infrastructure to design for the streaming gateways we handle all
that heavy lifting for you the service has a full exposed API so you can use it
